parameters.name: AbnormalDuration
parameters.description: The duration threshold for triggering automatic SQL throttling. Set this parameter to an integer that is greater than or equal to 2. Unit: minutes.

parameters.name: ActiveSessions
parameters.description:
The threshold for the number of active sessions.

*   If this parameter and CpuUsage are in the **OR** relationship, set this parameter to an integer that is greater than or equal to 16.
*   If this parameter and CpuUsage are in the **AND** relationship, set this parameter to an integer that is greater than or equal to 2.

parameters.name: AllowThrottleEndTime
parameters.description: The end time of the throttling window. The time must be in UTC.

parameters.name: AllowThrottleStartTime
parameters.description: The start time of the throttling window. The time must be in UTC.

parameters.name: AutoKillSession
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to terminate abnormal SQL statements in execution at the same time. Valid values:

>  Abnormal SQL statements use the same template as the SQL statements to be throttled.

*   **true**
*   **false**

parameters.name: CpuSessionRelation
parameters.description:
The logical relationship between the CPU utilization threshold and the maximum number of active sessions. Valid values:

*   **AND**
*   **OR**

parameters.name: CpuUsage
parameters.description: The threshold for CPU utilization. Valid values: 70% to 100%.

parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description:
The database instance IDs.

>  Set this parameter to a JSON array that consists of multiple instance IDs. Separate instance IDs with commas (,). Example: `['Instance ID1', 'Instance ID2']`.

parameters.name: MaxThrottleTime
parameters.description: The maximum throttling duration. Set this parameter to a positive integer. Unit: minutes.

parameters.name: ResultId
parameters.description:
The ID of the asynchronous request.

>  You can leave this parameter empty when you call the operation to initiate the request for the first time, and use the value of this parameter contained in the response to the first request for subsequent requests.
